meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: GUNSMITHS

div.a: Crowdsourced Weaponry: How Syrian Rebels Are Fighting Back

div.div: Working together and at the urging of antigovernment fighters, local businesses and tradesmen have organized into a network engaged in making weapons, in part by delegating different tasks among the various trades.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OonRTG&via=Digg&text=Crowdsourced Weaponry: How Syrian Rebels Are Fighting Back

div.div: DIRECT FLIGHTS AVAILABLE TO MIDDLE-EARTH

div.a: New Zealand Is Officially Pretending It's Middle-Earth Now

div.div: This is the new New Zealand tourism campaign, and it's the smartest thing the Kiwis have done since giving Peter Jackson another round of tax breaks to film The Hobbit movies there. Really, can officially renaming the country to Middle-Earth really be that far behind?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pl39rs&via=Digg&text=New Zealand Is Officially Pretending It's Middle-Earth Now

div.div: YES, THIS IS REAL LIFE

div.a: Insane Clown Posse Reviews 'Call Me Maybe'

div.div: In this debut episode of ICP Theater—which is basically Mystery Science Theater 3000 meets Beavis and Butt-head meets... clowns—the one and only Insane Clown Posse sit down and watch Carly Rae Jepsen's megahit "Call Me Maybe" for the very first time.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PYvMIX&via=Digg&text=Insane Clown Posse Reviews 'Call Me Maybe'

div.div: HURRICANE IMPOSTERS

div.a: The Real Story Behind The Incredible Storm Photo That Just Won't Die

div.div: Over the weekend, something almost as cyclical as storms themselves began spreading across social media — an old, dramatic image of a green-ish cloud hovering above water.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RjsrRQ&via=Digg&text=The Real Story Behind The Incredible Storm Photo That Just Won't Die

div.div: SCIENTIFIC CARTOGRAPHY

div.a: A Beautiful 1939 Map Of The Land Of Physics

div.div: "Geography was my favourite subject in school; physics the one I disliked the most. If only I’d known about this Map of Physics!"

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U5seWj&via=Digg&text=A Beautiful 1939 Map Of The Land Of Physics

div.div: ALCOHOL KILLS
The deaths have, not surprisingly, stunned the close-knit chicken-raising community on the Eastern Shore.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RqCuse&via=Digg&text=Drunk Man Accidentally Kills 70,000 Chickens

div.div: PROGRAMMING A GENIUS

div.a: This Is Apple's Secret Employee Training Manual

div.div: Apple tells its new recruits exactly what what to think and say. How do we know? We read Apple's secret Genius Training Manual from cover to cover.

li.div: My favorite part of the banned words list at Apple is not being able to say something is hot. Warm only! gizmodo.com/5938323/how-to-be-...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TpeSlw&via=Digg&text=This Is Apple's Secret Employee Training Manual

div.div: BUBBLES

div.a: The Startup Model Is Broken, Here's How To Fix It

div.div: The market for internet companies is broken. We cannot continue starting companies with millions in venture capital and no business model from day one that generates revenue, and more importantly profit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Omkrka&via=Digg&text=The Startup Model Is Broken, Here's How To Fix It

div.div: FACT OR FICTION

div.a: Does Sitting Too Close To The TV Really Ruin Your Eyesight?

div.div: "Don't sit too close to the TV or you'll ruin your eyesight!" was once uttered by concerned parents around the world. And at one point in time, it actually may have been true.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U8tS9q&via=Digg&text=Does Sitting Too Close To The TV Really Ruin Your Eyesight?

div.div: WHAT'S WORSE: KLOUT OR THE ELECTORAL COLLEGE?

div.a: Social Media Takes The Stage At Conventions

div.div: The social networks are out in force here at the RNC, indicating a shift from reflecting to trying to direct the political conversation.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RjqR2k&via=Digg&text=Social Media Takes The Stage At Conventions

div.div: CHILDHOOD DREAMS

div.a: What Did You Want To Accomplish When You Grew Up?

div.div: When you're a kid, there are no limits on the world—everything seems possible.

li.div: These are dreamy, lovely, inspiring >> What Did You Want To Accomplish When You Grew Up? theawl.com/2012/08/what-di...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SN444J&via=Digg&text=What Did You Want To Accomplish When You Grew Up?

div.div: WHEREAS MEDVEDEV HAD AN OUTHOUSE

Being the president of Russia sounds awesome: Not only do you get to blow off boring state meetings to go for drinks with your biker buddies, but the perks include four yachts and 43 planes, one with a $75,000 toilet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QsPH4K&via=Digg&text=Putin Has A $75,000 Toilet

div.div: IN RUSSIA, WARHEAD TOURS YOU!

div.a: Russia Entices Visitors With Nuclear Warheads

div.div: A poster designed to entice tourists to visit Moscow depicts a harmonious scene of cathedrals, green riverbanks and boat trips. But on closer inspection it become clear that vehicles travelling down a road are in fact a convoy of military trucks carrying intercontinental ballistic missiles.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rpzw7r&via=Digg&text=Russia Entices Visitors With Nuclear Warheads

div.div: PHOTOGRAPHY

div.a: A Million Photos All Shot Through The Same Window

div.div: How creative could you be if you could only photograph through a single window of your house?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U8x19j&via=Digg&text=A Million Photos All Shot Through The Same Window

div.div: FOOD

div.a: Two Of America's Best Restaurants To Trade Places

div.div: For a brief spell starting on Sept. 26, Eleven Madison Park will turn itself into an altogether different restaurant. One that usually happens to be in … Chicago.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U8NyKu&via=Digg&text=Two Of America's Best Restaurants To Trade Places

div.div: CAN WE REPLACE DRONES WITH THESE?

div.a: This Guy Built A Fire-Breathing, Jet-Powered Dragon

div.div: The dragon can fly faster than 100mph, but builder Richard Hamel keeps it at a cruising speed closer to 70.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MGDfcY&via=Digg&text=This Guy Built A Fire-Breathing, Jet-Powered Dragon

div.div: DIY SATELLITES

div.a: NASA Builds Your Own Private Satellite -- With Google Android

div.div: What would you do with your own private satellite? If you haven’t decided, you should. PhoneSat — a project overseen by NASA’s Ames Research Center in Silicon Valley — wants to lower the cost of building space satellites to the point where anyone with space ambitions could launch one.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NUuQaj&via=Digg&text=NASA Builds Your Own Private Satellite -- With Google Android

div.div: SIGNATURES

div.a: You're Less Likely To Lie If You Sign Your Name Before Filling Out Forms

div.div: Signing one’s name before reporting information (rather than at the end) makes morality accessible right before it is most needed, which will consequently promote honest reporting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ppw1u4&via=Digg&text=You're Less Likely To Lie If You Sign Your Name Before Filling Out Forms

div.div: FOOD

div.a: What Mormon Food Culture Says About Mitt Romney

div.div: Parsing the eating habits of presidential candidates (to say nothing of sitting presidents) is now firmly embedded in America's cultural milieu.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OmHR97&via=Digg&text=What Mormon Food Culture Says About Mitt Romney

div.div: SPACE JAMS

div.a: Will.i.am Song Gets Exclusive Martian Airtime

div.div: With a little bit of help from Nasa, Will.i.am's "Reach for the Stars" will be broadcast 166 million miles from Earth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SMtSfK&via=Digg&text=Will.i.am Song Gets Exclusive Martian Airtime

div.div: PUSSY RIOT
In Tampa, a bunch of women dressed up as vaginas to protest the Republican National Convention.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QPwODy&via=Digg&text=Vaginas Protest Republican Convention
